page.title: 01AREA SOUTH-WEST OF CREWKERNE
page.content: This area is predominantly agricultural, farms being mainly 100-300 acres. Parts are considered by planners to be of outstanding natural beauty. All farms privately owned. One has 10,000 pigs. Patches of woodland dot the area. High points are in ther N.W., over 700 ft, and Seaborough Hill almost 700ft. Practically all streams flow South to join the River Axe. The only concentreated residential area is the Southern part of Crewkerne. Five small villages nestle in the Axe Valley. Two have lost their parsonages to private ownership and two schools have recently been coverted. Many householders are retired, some are farmworkers, many commute to Westlands Helicopter Works, Yeovil. Clapton Court Gardens are open daily. Henley Manor is one of I.C.I's two grassland experimental farms. The proprietors of
